title: Chicken Tostadas
ingredients: ½ (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix
¼ cup salsa, or to taste (Optional)
¼ cup sour cream, or to taste (Optional)
method: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Step 2: Place chicken into a frying pan over medium heat. Sprinkle with taco seasoning and cook until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 5 to 7 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

Step 3: Spread a thin layer of refried beans onto each tostada shell; sprinkle each with Mexican cheese. Divide cooked chicken on top of cheese layer. Sprinkle tomato, red onion, and bell pepper evenly on top of each tostada. Place tostadas on a baking sheet.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, 10 to 15 minutes.
Step 5: Remove tostadas from the oven. Sprinkle with cilantro and spread salsa and sour cream on top.
Step 6: You can use chicken thighs instead of chicken breasts, if you'd like.
